result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:51 AM Defendant Brian G. Mikkelson in court by video, in custody at the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Defense argues for bond modification, state objects with argument. Court grants modification. Court sets $3000 cash bond with same conditions.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim K.R.L., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Preliminary hearing requested, within time time limits, by zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
